title: Fact check: Kathy Barnette's positions on Black Lives Matter, race and ...
summary: A super PAC supporting Mehmet Oz released an ad that misrepresents Kathy Barnette's positions on Black Lives Matter, racial issues, and policing. The ad misleadingly edited Barnette's past remarks, taken out of context from a May 2020 commentary where she explicitly denied systemic racism among police and criticized violence. The ad incorrectly suggests Barnette supports Black Lives Matter, whereas she has criticized it and attributed social unrest in the Black community to historical white racism, as per the 1967 Kerner Commission, not contemporary issues or the movement. Additionally, Barnette proposed erecting a statue of Barack Obama as a unifying symbol amid the debate on removing statues, arguing it would acknowledge improved racial relations in the U.S., despite having criticized Obama in the past.

title: Kathy Barnette responds to Trump, GOP and past controversial tweets
summary: Kathy Barnette, a surging Republican Senate candidate in Pennsylvania, has faced scrutiny over her past controversial statements and actions. One key point of criticism is her support for building a statue of Barack Obama next to Abraham Lincoln on Capitol Hill, referenced in a political ad. The ad cites a Change.org petition that advocates for statues of Obama and abolitionist Frederick Douglass in Washington, D.C. While NBC News hasn't independently verified Barnette’s authorship of the petition, the ad positions this as a significant issue. Barnette responded to various political challenges, including Trump's comments on her electability, and emphasized her pro-life stance, while defending her actions related to January 6 and controversial past tweets. The statement 'Kathy Barnette wants to build a statue of Barack Obama right next to the one of Abraham Lincoln on Capitol Hill' is true, based on the content provided. The political ad referenced in the text criticizes Barnette for supporting the erection of such a statue, mentioning a Change.org petition advocating for it. However, it's important to note that the authenticity of the petition being authored by Barnette has not been independently verified by NBC News.
